description.narrative: IR 4.6: Programme Support, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Supply And Logistics, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Unicef Capacity For Supply And Logistics. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Y108 - Programme Component Results (PCR) 4 Cross SectoralIn target districts schools, health facilities and communities in emergency settings have improved water and sanitation facilities o and Community Led Total Sanitation (CLTS) is introduced in target villages.b) Increased influence of youth on national agenda for realization child rights, effective participatory communication processes for child focused behavioural and social change and increased awareness at national and international levels of situation of children and women in Uganda.c) Responsiveness of UN Delivery-As- One to child rights and development/scaling up of technological innovative approaches for improved service delivery, accountability and transparency.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: CO/RO Supply - technical assistance and collaboration in supply chain, procurement of goods and services, and logistics
HQ and RO technical support to multiple Goal Areas

description.narrative: Other General Services other general services

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework

UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners

Uganda 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
